Who are they?
At the heart of Brigad, there is the idea that everyone should have the opportunity to pursue their passion by being valued, considered and above all, free. This includes finding fulfilment in your work and career, being able to balance it with your personal life, being fairly compensated and being respected.
Brigad is proud to give to thousands of talents today, and millions tomorrow, the means to achieve this lifestyle, and we believe so firmly in our mission â€œTo value work and make it accessible to allâ€ that we have written it into our mission statement.
Since 2016, this ambition has materialised by providing our users with the best app on the market to connect self-employed professionals with healthcare and catering establishments for short-term missions.
â­ï¸ Our users are right, giving Brigad an NPS of 77/100 out of 5000 responses, and sharing how Brigad changed their lives!
If originally Brigad deployed itself in the catering (restaurants, collective catering) and healthcare sectors (care homes and clinics), tomorrow, even more sectors will be concerned: everywhere talents arenâ€™t equipped to pursue their passion while being properly considered and free.
Brigad is currently available in the largest cities in France (Paris, Lille, Lyon, Bordeaux, Marseille, Strasbourg..) and in the UK (London, Manchester, Birminghamâ€¦), with the ambition to expand well beyond in France and Europe.
Exciting challenges are waiting for you: expect to discover new countries in which Brigad will expand, new industries, a top-notch product, a fast-paced development, and above all a solid team united around a truly concrete and positive impact on our daily usersâ€™ lives. A spirit that can, also be found on Glassdoor and the grade of 4.6/5.
Does this sound like the perfect fit for you? Great! Feel free to apply and letâ€™s talk about it. âœ¨

Job description
-> Your mission
The Sales Development Representative will be responsible for hunting, closing and onboarding independent and multi-owner sites in the sector (aka Sales Hospitality Long Tail UK). Your role as Sales Development Representative is to generate business opportunities by identifying and targeting leads for the team.
-> Your responsibilities
Manage the first part of the sales cycle: prospecting, lead gen, cold calls, pre-qualification via calls, video conferences and emailing.
Pre-qualify as many leads as possible and book as many meetings as possible for the BD team
Qualify and update the CRM database to improve lead scoring
Identify and import new leads
Collaborate with the Sales, Sales Ops and Sales Enablement teams
Preferred experience
If you haveâ€¦
A first experience in sales, commercial relations in an internship and/or student job
Good speaking skills to make a strong impact on the phone.
A real sales mindset - the desire to convince and achieve objectives.
The ability to work independently and take initiative in sales.
A positive and contagious energy!
Native English is essential, a good level of French is also expected.
You are convinced of the Brigad project and you share the values we stand for

Titre: Bras droit CEO / Chief of Staff intern
Description:
Who are they?
At the heart of Brigad, there is the idea that everyone should have the opportunity to pursue their passion by being valued, considered and above all, free. This includes finding fulfilment in your work and career, being able to balance it with your personal life, being fairly compensated and being respected.
Brigad is proud to give to thousands of talents today, and millions tomorrow, the means to achieve this lifestyle, and we believe so firmly in our mission â€œTo value work and make it accessible to allâ€ that we have written it into our mission statement.
Since 2016, this ambition has materialised by providing our users with the best app on the market to connect self-employed professionals with healthcare and catering establishments for short-term missions.
â­ï¸ Our users are right, giving Brigad an NPS of 77/100 out of 5000 responses, and sharing how Brigad changed their lives!
If originally Brigad deployed itself in the catering (restaurants, collective catering) and healthcare sectors (care homes and clinics), tomorrow, even more sectors will be concerned: everywhere talents arenâ€™t equipped to pursue their passion while being properly considered and free.
Brigad is currently available in the largest cities in France (Paris, Lille, Lyon, Bordeaux, Marseille, Strasbourg..) and in the UK (London, Manchester, Birminghamâ€¦), with the ambition to expand well beyond in France and Europe.
Exciting challenges are waiting for you: expect to discover new countries in which Brigad will expand, new industries, a top-notch product, a fast-paced development, and above all a solid team united around a truly concrete and positive impact on our daily usersâ€™ lives. A spirit that can, also be found on Glassdoor and the grade of 4.6/5.
Does this sound like the perfect fit for you? Great! Feel free to apply and letâ€™s talk about it. âœ¨
Want to know more about BRIGAD?

Job description
â†’ Your mission
As the right hand of the Chief of Staff, you will report to the CoS and you will work closely with the CEO and all the exec team. You will have the opportunity to collaborate on important strategic initiatives and work on projects across various fields.
â†’ Your responsibilities
Internal communication: you will help the CoS to prepare the agenda and materials of the companyâ€™s monthly all hands and reviews.
Governance: you will assist the CoS in the preparation of the agenda and the follow-up for exec team meetings.
Investor relation : you will contribute to the writing of investors reports and to the preparation of the agenda, materials and minutes for board meetings.
OKRs : the OKRs are owned by the CoS. You will contribute to the definition of OKRs and their follow-up and you will help to improve the current process.
Mission report : we are a mission-driven company. You will be involved in the writing of our annual mission report.
Market research & strategy: you will participate in exploring new ventures such as competitive intelligence, country launch, new business lines, M&A, etc. You will work closely with the team on strategic cross-teams projects, and ensure they are delivered on time.
Preferred experience
If you haveâ€¦
A previous internship experience, ideally in a consulting firm or scale-up.
Strong analytical skills
Execution, you are reliable and efficient
Adaptability, you have a strong ability to adapt, and you are curious
Excellent communication skills, you can interact with different personalities at all levels and worldwide, you are persuasive but also empathetic and open-minded.
You are fluent in French and English.
â€¦ Then apply quickly! We look forward to meeting you! Here are all the other advantages by joining us

Job description
Your mission
You will train with and assist the Data Engineering team in the development and deployment of data ingestion pipelines, data access solutions, and databases in order to generate actionable insights for the Brigad teams.
Your responsibilities
Support of Data Analytics team regarding data availability
Development of ingestion pipelines for new data sources
Raw data cleaning, deduplication and normalization
Development and maintenance of orchestration pipelines
Support of Product Development team in data products creation
Optimization of distributed computing in a Big Data framework (Spark / Databricks)
Preferred experience
Ifâ€¦
You are in the final stages of your studies in engineering school, computer science school or master in computer science, preferably with a specialization in data
You have an analytical aptitude, and a real interest in data
You have a good level in SQL, in Bash and you must know how to work with at least one programming language (Python is a plus)
You are versatile and like to work with new technologies and frameworks that you are not familiar with
You have a good level in English
â€¦ Then apply quickly! We look forward to meeting you!

Job description
Partnerships are at the heart of our DNA and are one of the main drivers of our growth. In Brand Partnerships & Ad Sales, we donâ€™t just offer and sell advertising space, we develop tailor-made solutions and create impactful journeys to meet our partnersâ€™ consumer marketing objectives. Deezer Subscription Partnerships is one of our main lines of services and we are looking for a Subscription Sales Specialist to help grow the partnerships portfolio within Deezerâ€™s global key markets.
Which department: Brand Partnerships & AdSales
Mission of the team in a few words: Create meaningful partnerships with brands that share our values
Mission of the job in a few words: Generate new leads, prepare proposals, pitch and negotiate revenue-driven subscription partnerships across our key global markets
Team: Reporting into the Head of Brand Subscription Sales
What you will do:
Generate leads of potential partners on the Subscription line of service
Manage negotiations with strategic clients across different verticals: Direct clients, marketing agencies, resellers and work councils
Create an innovative approaches to new business acquisition
Develop effective account management to ensure deal renewals with strategic partners
Work closely with other Brand Partnerships & Ad Sales teams to create 360 partner solutions
At Deezer, you can be your true self as we believe that #everyvoicematters. We strive to build an inclusive culture and foster a diverse environment. Because we care and want to ensure each employee feels welcome and safe at work, we continuously focus on fighting biases and helping diverse teams work well together through multiple learning opportunities, e-learnings and workshops right from the onboarding :
Regular Diversity & Inclusion internal and external talks
Dedicated employee work streams on Gender equity, Ethnicity & Culture, Disability and LGBTQ+
Multiple e-learnings and mandatory training sessions for all managers
English and French courses for all, so that everyone can connect and feel included
Beyond benefits like transportation, we offer you extra perks like:
A Deezer premium family account for free
Access to gym classes
Deezer parties several times a year and drinks every thursday
Allowance for sports, travelling and culture
Meal vouchers
Great offices always located in dynamic and attractive districts, whether in Paris, London, Berlin or Sao Paulo!
If you want to learn more about life and culture at Deezer, please visit our Welcome to the Jungle page here!
Preferred experience
This role is excellent for a person with:
Experience in partnerships and sales
Demonstrated experience in achieving sales KPIs
Detailed knowledge of sales skills including lead generation, pipeline management and deal closing techniques
Outstanding oral and written communication skills
High level of time management, prioritization and organization
Fluency in French and English

Job description
We are currently looking for a Financial Analyst Intern to join our Financial Planning & Analysis team, which is in charge of elaborating and monitoring the budget, assessing operational projects from a Finance perspective, analyzing Deezer's performance, and accompanying operational teams in their various projects.
This is a 6-month internship from July 2023.
What you will do: 
You will assist the Senior Financial Analyst in the following areas:
Monthly closing :
> Assist with month-end financial reports (P&L, accruals, KPI)
> Prepare the data inputs necessary for revenue, royalties and expenses calculations
> Provide ad hoc financial analysis
P&L follow-up:
> Ensure the correct analytical splits and analyze variations (budget, growthâ€¦)
> Provide ad-hoc financial analysis
Financial modeling:
> Analyze new business opportunities
> Update business plans and provide monthly financial analysis
Budget/ Reforecast:
> Work on yearly forecasting process
> Update and maintain business plans

Who are they?

In order to improve the performance and impact of brands, and consumersâ€™ experience, we assemble lots of different talents: data application engineers, data scientists, creatives and designers, advertising strategists and consultants. In only four years, Artefact has become one of the international references for Data and IA expertise. The society counts today more than 1000 collaborators worldwide, in 17 countries and gathers 3 complementary offers: Data Consulting, Digital Marketing expertise and the Deployment of Technologies (Big Data and Artificial Intelligence).

Job description
Who we are
Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say weâ€™re enjoying skyrocketing growth.
Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clientsâ€™ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise weâ€™ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.
We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.
What you will be doing
You will join our Data Marketing Consulting team which helps clients transform and improve their marketing strategy by applying advanced analytics to generate value-creating insights from big data and artificial intelligence.
 Key responsibilities
As a Data Scientist Intern, your role will encompass:
Conducting ambitious projects in the transformation of clients through data
Collaborating with the other Divisions (Activation, Creativity, and Strategy) to provide comprehensive services to your clients
Developing privileged relationships with our clients, using your technical abilities to assist in the transformation of their marketing department
Among your responsibilities as a Data Scientist Intern, you will be responsible for:
Performing data projects
Securing delivery on your projects
Communicating your work and achievements among the team
Working closely with your Consulting counterpart to build and maintain strong relationships with your clients and best understand their needs
Ensuring that your solutions are bringing values to the client problematic
Being a good team player, knowing your role and responsibility in the global ambition
Being a great tech person
Demonstrating the skill and credibility required to ensure the success of our clientsâ€™ initiatives
Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently
Sharing best practices and contributing to Artefactâ€™s institutional knowledge
Embodying Artefactâ€™s values and inspiring others to do the same
 What we are looking for
Currently pursuing a BA/BS or MA/MS in machine learning, mathematics, computer science, or related fields (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field) from an accredited college or university.
0-1 years of related experience supporting engineering, information technology or other technical operations. A first experience (internship, school project, Junior Entreprise, etc.) in consulting and/or data ecosystem would be a plus.
Good understanding of the digital and data ecosystem and its technologies: web analytics, programmatic, DMP, Datalake, dataviz, data science, etc.
Strong interest in marketing & business issues
Intellectual curiosity, along with on excellent problem-solving skill, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root causes and recommend solutions
A practical and analytical mind-set, you will be passionate about the creation of bespoke solutions for our clients
Continuously striving for high performance in all you do
Good Communication skills
Ideal candidates should be passionate about using business acumen along with big data and analytics to address real-world problems and drive significant change.
 Why you should join us
Artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of marketing
Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine
Entrepreneurship: you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We wonâ€™t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!
 Come join us!

Who are they?
Platform.sh is a unified, secure, enterprise-grade platform for building, running and scaling fleets of websites
and applications.
We believe in a future where digital infrastructure is at once everywhere and invisible. Where innovation is possible without technical barriers and with reduced impact on our environment.
Platform.sh is a VC-backed scale-up headquartered in Paris with employees across three continents. Among our clients you can find key accounts, such as Vivienne Westwood, British high-end fashion retailer Reiss, the Canadian Football League, the British Council, Parc Asterix, Seloger.com, the German startup Flixbus or the South-American El Universo.
Want to know more about Platform.sh?
Company culture, teams, jobs... Let's go for an immersion!
Visit the profile
Meet Fred, CEO
Meet Sawssen, Manager of the Technical Account Management team
Meet Augustin, Product Delivery Manager
Job description
About Platform.sh
Platform.sh is a remote-first global workforce building a better cloud platform to create, manage and responsibly scale web applications.
As a collective with diverse backgrounds, we work together to test, innovate, and challenge one another, finding new ways to reimagine digital experiences. Weâ€™re here to help our customers thrive.
Bring your experience to our team, and help us build a better way.
Position summary
Platform.sh is looking for an Accountant - AP intern (Level: BTS or Bac+2). You will report to our Senior General Accounting Specialist, within a dynamic finance team; in an international and scaling up context, supporting our entities all around the world.
The duration of the internship is 6 months in Paris and the remuneration for this position is a minimum â‚¬500/month.
You must be under an internship agreement through university/school for the whole period of the internship.
What you can expect
To take care of the supplier invoice process (in terms of Tax, PSH entity billed) and approval flow verification,
Booking entries and bills into our ERP (Netsuite), to prepare supplier payments and follow-up of due dates.
To do the Bank follow-up (supplier payment) and reconciliation in Netsuite.
Handling reminders from suppliers and AP reconciling
To create and update Vendors in Netsuite
Archiving of accounting documents physically or virtually (on Google Drive)
To learn and do other ad hoc tasks based on business needs
What you bring
Your BTS or Bac+2 in Accounting.
Fluent in French and good in English.
Some knowledge or ideally previous experience of an ERP
Knowledge and your proficiency using GSuite / Microsoft Office Suite (Excel)
Good interpersonal, customer service and communication skills to collaborate with internal teams and third parties
Highly organized to manage multiple tasks.
Pragmatism and detail orientated to be accurate and precise in the information you will manage.`
Ability to work autonomously.
What we bring as a team
We trust each other - Try, succeed, fail we will always have your back!
We have fun - We work seriously without taking ourselves too seriously.
We are team players - Teamwork makes the dream work!
We are transparent - We believe in explicit communication and constructive feedback.
Work from our offices in Paris, or at home
Weâ€™re a worldwide, distributed team looking for the best talent.
To maximize team collaboration with Strategy and Engineering teams, you would be expected to come to our Paris office, at least 2 to 3 times a week.
Company perks and benefits
We provide an innovative product you can believe in. Weâ€™re sustainably changing the way companies develop and manage their web applications.
Weâ€™re voted as A Best Place to Work by 96% of our employees, Forbes Top 30 Companies for Remote Jobs, and in France Best Workplaces for Women.
Hands on leadership that cares in a flexible, open work environment, where your voice is encouraged. We can always find ways to do better and look forward to hearing your ideas.
A global team, rich with culture and diversity.
Company-wide DE&I initiative that you can be a part of.
Tandem â€“ a pool of linguists from around the world willing to help each other work on learning new languages.
Unlimited Platform.sh accounts.
How we hire
We know that a great hire wonâ€™t meet every requirement that weâ€™ve outlined. If you can see yourself elevating the team, we want to hear your story. Few of us would be here had we not taken a chance.
You can expect 2-3 interviews on Google Meet. You will have the opportunity to meet with a variety of Platformers throughout the interview process.
All roles require background checks.
About our software
Platform.sh is a unified, secure, enterprise-grade platform to build, run, and scale fleets of websites and applications. We are trusted by 5500+ organizations globally to help create innovative digital experiences.Platform.sh is a unified, secure, enterprise-grade platform for building, running and scaling fleets of websites
and applications.
We believe in a future where digital infrastructure is at once everywhere and invisible. Where innovation is possible without technical barriers and with reduced impact on our environment.
Platform.sh is a VC-backed scale-up headquartered in Paris with employees across three continents. Among our clients you can find key accounts, such as Vivienne Westwood, British high-end fashion retailer Reiss, the Canadian Football League, the British Council, Parc Asterix, Seloger.com, the German startup Flixbus or the South-American El Universo.About Platform.sh
Platform.sh is a remote-first global workforce building a better cloud platform to create, manage and responsibly scale web applications.
As a collective with diverse backgrounds, we work together to test, innovate, and challenge one another, finding new ways to reimagine digital experiences. Weâ€™re here to help our customers thrive.
Bring your experience to our team, and help us build a better way.
Position summary
Platform.sh is looking for an Accountant - AP intern (Level: BTS or Bac+2). You will report to our Senior General Accounting Specialist, within a dynamic finance team; in an international and scaling up context, supporting our entities all around the world.
The duration of the internship is 6 months in Paris and the remuneration for this position is a minimum â‚¬500/month.
You must be under an internship agreement through university/school for the whole period of the internship.
What you can expect
To take care of the supplier invoice process (in terms of Tax, PSH entity billed) and approval flow verification,
Booking entries and bills into our ERP (Netsuite), to prepare supplier payments and follow-up of due dates.
To do the Bank follow-up (supplier payment) and reconciliation in Netsuite.
Handling reminders from suppliers and AP reconciling
To create and update Vendors in Netsuite
Archiving of accounting documents physically or virtually (on Google Drive)
To learn and do other ad hoc tasks based on business needs
What you bring
Your BTS or Bac+2 in Accounting.
Fluent in French and good in English.
Some knowledge or ideally previous experience of an ERP
Knowledge and your proficiency using GSuite / Microsoft Office Suite (Excel)
Good interpersonal, customer service and communication skills to collaborate with internal teams and third parties
Highly organized to manage multiple tasks.
Pragmatism and detail orientated to be accurate and precise in the information you will manage.`
Ability to work autonomously.
What we bring as a team
We trust each other - Try, succeed, fail we will always have your back!
We have fun - We work seriously without taking ourselves too seriously.
We are team players - Teamwork makes the dream work!
We are transparent - We believe in explicit communication and constructive feedback.
Work from our offices in Paris, or at home
Weâ€™re a worldwide, distributed team looking for the best talent.
To maximize team collaboration with Strategy and Engineering teams, you would be expected to come to our Paris office, at least 2 to 3 times a week.
Company perks and benefits
We provide an innovative product you can believe in. Weâ€™re sustainably changing the way companies develop and manage their web applications.
Weâ€™re voted as A Best Place to Work by 96% of our employees, Forbes Top 30 Companies for Remote Jobs, and in France Best Workplaces for Women.
Hands on leadership that cares in a flexible, open work environment, where your voice is encouraged. We can always find ways to do better and look forward to hearing your ideas.
A global team, rich with culture and diversity.
Company-wide DE&I initiative that you can be a part of.
Tandem â€“ a pool of linguists from around the world willing to help each other work on learning new languages.
Unlimited Platform.sh accounts.
How we hire
We know that a great hire wonâ€™t meet every requirement that weâ€™ve outlined. If you can see yourself elevating the team, we want to hear your story. Few of us would be here had we not taken a chance.
You can expect 2-3 interviews on Google Meet. You will have the opportunity to meet with a variety of Platformers throughout the interview process.
All roles require background checks.
About our software
Platform.sh is a unified, secure, enterprise-grade platform to build, run, and scale fleets of websites and applications. We are trusted by 5500+ organizations globally to help create innovative digital experiences.

Who are they?
Valiantys is the leading global consulting and services firm dedicated to Atlassian. Valiantys accelerates business transformation by digitizing processes and modernizing teamwork, using the best Agile methods and tools. Their Atlassian technical expertise is unparalleled and they support their customers across the entire spectrum of their projects on those platforms. Because teamwork requires more than just tools, Valiantys helps them bridge the gap between their applications and strategic practices such as SAFe and ITIL.
Over the last 15 years, Valiantys has helped in excess of 5,000 customers to achieve their desired business outcomes at a reduced time to value, through improved team collaboration.
Want to know more about Valiantys?
Company culture, teams, jobs... Let's go for an immersion!
Visit the profile
Rencontrez JÃ©rÃ´me, General Manager et COO
Rencontrez Elodie, Consultante
Rencontrez Alexandrine, Business Operations Manager
Job description
Our Global Senior Marketing Manager based in Canada is looking for a marketing student to complete a 6 month full time internship from September 2023. The position is based in Toulouse.
Surrounded by a multicultural and dynamic team, using innovative collaborative work methods and tools, your missions will be based on the organization of market research and project coordination. 
If you are motivated and ambitious, this internship will be an opportunity to acquire and develop strategic marketing research capabilities, project management skills, and communication skills within a fast growing international agile company.
Project coordination and communication 
*Develop communication materials (invitation emails, social media posts etc.) in English and French 
*Collaborate with the marketing agency and implement actions to attract new customers globally (email, social ads, and SEO campaigns etc.).
*Facilitate the regional adoption of the initiatives. 
Manage the timelines and deliverables, report on the progress, and flag the possible issues for the initiatives you lead. 
Market research
*Work with the Senior Manager on the strategic account research 
*Possibly work with the Senior Manager on competitor analysis 
*Include the collected info into database 
What you need to be successful
You are a student at the end of the cycle in marketing OR you are doing a gap year from September 2023
And you are ...
*Communication - You are an excellent communicator (written and spoken.) Whatever the subject, you are able to speak to what your audience and readers need. You think about what's important for your audience and use the professional language.  
*Strategy thinking - You are able to capture the strategic guidance and can reflect in daily work and research with the overarching strategy in mind. 
*Organization - You know how to manage priorities and timelines. You are able to carry out several projects in parallel, to follow them through until their successful execution, especially when deadlines are tight.
*Project management - Autonomous, proactive, and organized, you are able to analyze and design an action plan, execute it, and refine it, while ensuring effective reporting.
*Interest in the IT industry - You are curious and interested in IT ecosystem. You know how to quickly take in hand a new subject and talk about it. You are comfortable with the techy environment and learning about the new software systems. 
*English - You must be able to communicate fluently both in writing and orally: communications are mainly in English.
*French - The spelling and syntax pro: it's YOU!
*Team Spirit - You like working in a team and you fit easily into a group. You are comfortable asking for or giving help when the need arises. 
Why you should apply?
People are our biggest asset and we work hard to make sure Valiantys is not only a great place to work but also provides a platform for you to grow.
*Ownership. You will have a very strong influence on the strategy and will have ownership of your scope.
*Training. We provide the time and budget to help you grow.
*Flexibility. We understand life is about balance and we provide flexibility and support to help you achieve your life goals.
*Benefits: 
-Generous lunch vouchers
-Top spec machine as you prefer (MAC or PC)
-International work environment and a multicultural team
-Games, free coffee, tea and fresh fruits because we care about your health!

Who are they?
Aircall is on a mission to revolutionize the business phone industry!
We exist to empower every professional to have richer conversations. We provide an entirely cloud-based voice solution, which seamlessly integrates with popular productivity and helpdesk tools. We have raised more than $220 million since 2015, and our base of 8000+ customers (and growing) is at our forefront.
Behind our product are the amazing teams driving it, split between Paris, New York, Sydney, Madrid, London, Berlin and remote locations. Despite our distance, we all work together to drive our product!

Who are they?
Dott is a European micromobility operator founded in 2018 by Henri Moissinac and Maxim Romain. Dott currently operates a fleet of over 40,000 electric scooters in major cities in Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, Norway, Poland, Spain and the UK. Paris is the first city to benefit from the new Dott electric bicycle service.
Dott, strives to move forward collectively to make our cities less polluted and less congested. For this it seems important to him to change the way we travel. Its mission is to offer sustainable and accessible mobility to all - for a peaceful city. Join the movement!
Want to know more about Dott?
Company culture, teams, technical stack, jobs... Let's go for an immersion!
Visit the profile
Rencontrez Maxim, COO & Co-Founder
Rencontrez Guillaume, Senior Software Engineer
Rencontrez Margot Monges, Senior Data Analyst
Job description
We believe in a future where inner cities are free of cars, congestion and pollution. By offering our dockless electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel, we believe we can make that future possible. Our mission is to free our cities with clean rides for everyone in Europe and beyond.
Founded in Europe, Dott is comprised of a highly experienced team of inquisitive minds in mobility and tech. What we do today has a tangible impact on tomorrow. We reached our in-house sustainability target of 100% renewable energy, and ensure equitability in our communities through collaborating with city charities, officials and safety boards.
You will be part of Dottâ€™s Central Operations team, which is responsible for enabling growth and supporting the local teams in all the countries in which Dottâ€™s operates.  You will be based in Paris and will be working on multiple cross-functional projects  always aiming to drive operational excellence. 
What youâ€™ll do
You will design, develop and optimise our operational processes by :
Identifying areas of improvement through data analysis and field interviews
Piloting and validating experiments by yourself
Defining and building metrics to monitor the adoption of a specific process
Evaluating and sharing the results to the entire company
Identifying new needs for our internal products
What you'll need
Great mix of hands on attitude and analytical skills
Result oriented and flawless motivation
Proven to be self-motivated, self-directed, and eager to take ownership of tasks to ensure success
Master level (engineering school, or university equivalent)
Proficient level of English
Closing & equal opportunities employer statement
Come as you are!
Dott is an equal opportunities employer. We invest in diversity, ensure equality and encourage expression. Description:

Avec 6 000 recrutements par an en France rejoignez AXA, un leader mondial de lâ€™assurance et de la gestion dâ€™actifs.
Ils accompagnent plus de 105 millions de clients qui leurs font confiance pour leurs biens, leur famille, leurs collaborateurs, leur patrimoine ou les actifs de leur entreprise.
Chaque jour, ils agissent ensemble pour vous protÃ©ger en donnant Ã  chacun les moyens de vivre une vie meilleure.

Company culture, teams, jobs... Let's go for an immersion!
Visit the profile
Culture + AXA
Rencontrez Xavier, GeÌrant de portefeuille
Rencontrez Sandra, Juriste Conseiller Protection Juridique
Job description
The AXA Group, world leader in Financial Protection, supports and advises its individual and corporate customers at every life stage, providing them with the products and services that meet their insurance, personal protection, savings and wealth management needs.
Our areas of expertise are reflected in a range of products and services adapted to the needs of each client in three major business lines: property-casualty insurance, life & savings, and asset management.
In 2019, present in 57 countries, the 160,000 employees and distributors of AXA were committed to serving 108 million clients.
AXA Corporate Centerâ€™s main missions are to:
Steer the entities in order to ensure the coherence of the strategies, the consistency of the commercial approaches as well as the optimization of the risks and results;
Defining and coordinating Group policies, different transversal projects and standards, identifying and sharing best practices;
Supporting the entities in order to help them to grow, to develop their offer, their management and steering standards as well as their risk management.
The head office of AXA Group (GIE AXA), based in La DÃ©fense Majunga, gathers the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities according to the Group's strategy and is responsible for managing international projects. The headquarters is composed with over 850 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities).
Management Presentation:
You will report to the Head of AXA SA Operational Risks & Internal Control as part of AXA SA Risk Management team within the central Group Risk Management function of the AXA Group. The team reports ultimately to AXA Group Chief Risk Officer.
Group Risk Management develops the risk & internal control framework standards and the minimum requirements or processes while AXA SA Risk management team shall implement the second line of defense for all AXA SA activities (Corporate, Financial Holding, Reinsurance) as well as GIE AXA services, coordinating with all key expert functions within GIE.
Core activities:
Within the Operational Risk & Internal Control team, you will participate to following activities:
As Internal Controller:
Providing support to 1st line managers to design and operate controls
Participating to working groups with control and business functions to review controls and monitor the risk mitigating action plans
Participating to 2nd line control activities for providing independent opinion on the design and operating effectiveness of controls set out by the 1st line including on Internal Model as part of Internal Financial Control Solvency II program and reporting to Group
As Risk Analyst:
Operational risk identification and assessment through workshops with first lines
Operational risk scenarios definition and quantification in line with Group Risk Management Standards
Monitoring Operational Risk Appetite and alert on any breaches
Operational Risk STEC computation and aggregation
Loss data and incident collection on a quarterly basis, reporting to Group Operational Risk Management
Key Risk Indicators monitoring and reporting on a quarterly basis
Reporting to AXA SA Operational Risk & Internal Control Committee on top operational risks and AXA SA contribution to Group Internal Model
Updating and reviewing operational risk policies
Monitoring Information risks with specific Key Risk Indicators, action plans and reporting to Group Information Risk
Develop Risk Management second opinions on key projects
Provide support to internal control function by conducting independent testing when relevant
Preferred experience
Technical and professional skills:
Current educational curriculum: Master degree (BAC+5) in Business Administration / Engineering / Actuarial, specializing in Insurance & Risk Management
Experience in risk management / internal control and proficiency in Solvency II regulation concepts & risk practices, ideally in insurance sector
Knowledge in (re)insurance business, Solvency II regulation and risk modeling is a plus
Project management capacities
Fluent in French
Proficient in English (C1 at least both in writing and speaking)
Soft skills:      
Proven high reliability, quality and timeliness of deliverables
Ability to work autonomously as well as in a team
Organizational skills
Ability to interact with a wide range of correspondents at various levels of management including regulators and auditors
Proficient writing and communicating skills (delivery of presentations, documentations)
Ability to build strong relationships and business partneringAvec 6 000 recrutements par an en France rejoignez AXA, un leader mondial de lâ€™assurance et de la gestion dâ€™actifs.
